column7: MMAS questions in KenyaEMR have beed designed differently in the form as compared to AMRS.  For AMRS concept ids were created for all the MMAS questions but for Kenya EMR, they seem to use control questions and the anly question that is stored in the database is the final rating, wether Good, inadequate or poor.

column2: Do you ever forget to take your medicine?
Are you careless at times about taking your medicine?
Sometimes if you feel worse when you take the medicine, do you stop taking it
When you feel better do you sometimes stop taking your medicine

column7: MMAS questions in KenyaEMR have beed designed differently in the form as compared to AMRS.  For AMRS concept ids were created for all the MMAS questions but for Kenya EMR, they seem to use control questions and the anly question that is stored in the database is the final rating, wether Good, inadequate or poor.

column2: Did you take the medicine yesterday
When you feel like your symptoms are under control, do you sometimes stop taking your medicine
Do you ever feel under pressure about sticking to your treatment plan
How often do you have difficulty remembering to take all your medications
Has patient received viral load result
Was the Viral load result suppressed (less than 1000) or unsuppressed (greater than 1000)
How does the patient feel concerning the result
What does the patient think caused the high viral load
(HIV and ART Knowledge) Assess patient's knowledge about HIV and ART; correct any misconceptions
Let the patient explan how they take their drugs, and at what time and how they store them
How does treatment fit the patient daily routines? What reminder tools are used
What does the patient do in case of visits and travels
What does the patient do incase of Side Effects
What are the most difficult situations for the patient to take drugs
How does the patient feel about taking drugs everyday
What are the patient ambitions in life?
Does the patient have any people in their life who they can talk to about HIV status and ART?
Discuss how the patient can enlist the support of their family
Review the patient's and family's sources of income and how well they cover their needs
Does the patient have any challenges getting the clinic on regular basis
Is the patient worried about people finding out about their HIV status accidentally
Does the patient feel like people treat them differently when they know their HIV status
Does stigma making it difficult for them to take their medications on time, or for them to attend clinical appointments
Find out if the patient has tried faith healing

column7: In AMRS, only one concept was created for this section but in Kenya EMR it has been split into different quesions.

column2: Does patient think adherence  has improved since last session
Review barriers to adherence from previous session and if strategies identified have been
Has the patient been referred to other services
What was the experience? Do the referrals need to be re-organized
Will the patient benefit from a home visit
